intro: Orthocarpus densiflorus var. noctuinus, commonly known as the night-flowering orthocarpus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that open primarily at night. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic compounds. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats. This species is of interest to botanists and gardeners due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit and medicinal potential.
